frontmatter.name: find-skills
frontmatter.description: Helps users discover and install agent skills when they ask questions like 'how do I do X', 'find a skill for X', 'is there a skill that can...', or express interest in extending capabilities. This skill should be used when the user is looking for functionality that might exist as an installable skill.

goals: Helps users discover and install skills from the open agent skills ecosystem
Enables searching for skills by domain (web development, testing, devOps, documentation, code quality, design, productivity)
Provides installation commands and links to skill documentation

frontmatter.name: maestro-task-creator
frontmatter.description: Create Auto Run task documents for Maestro with markdown checklists. Use when user wants to create tasks/playbooks for automated execution, needs help structuring work into task documents, or asks to 'create maestro tasks', 'make a playbook', 'break down into tasks', 'plan auto run workflow'.

goals: Create well-structured Auto Run task documents for Maestro
Enable spec-driven execution with clear, actionable task checklists that AI agents can execute independently
Provide session isolation with tasks designed for clean context in fresh AI sessions
Support iterative refinement with documents that can be reviewed, updated, and re-run
Enable progress tracking with checkboxes that mark completion state for each task

frontmatter.name: skill-creator
frontmatter.description: Guide for creating effective skills. This skill should be used when users want to create a new skill (or update an existing skill) that extends Claude's capabilities with specialized knowledge, workflows, or tool integrations.

goals: Provide guidance for creating effective skills
Help users understand what skills provide (specialized workflows, tool integrations, domain expertise, bundled resources)
Teach core principles: concise is key, set appropriate degrees of freedom, anatomy of a skill, progressive disclosure
Guide users through the 6-step skill creation process

frontmatter.name: te9-dev
frontmatter.description: Spec-driven development workflow for AI agents. Orchestrate requirements gathering, implementation, testing, and deployment in a structured 6-step process. Use this skill when building software, implementing features, or managing development workflows.

goals: Enable AI agents to execute a complete spec-driven development workflow
Gather requirements systematically through targeted questioning
Store specifications in a structured format for traceability
Manage version control through branching and pull requests
Facilitate collaborative review and approval processes
Provide clear audit trails and execution logging
